_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention Program and Emergency Response Policy
It is the policy of the Hexion Specialty Chemicals, Inc. (Hexion) Carpentersville, Il facility management to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68 and with the corresponding regulations under OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) Program.  The objective is to minimize the risk of a release of a hazardous material and if a release occurs, to minimize the potential impact to Hexion employees, the public and the environment. 
 
This objective will be accomplished by utilizing good general operating procedures, providing appropriate training to all employees, and coordinating response activities, as necessary, with the local emergency response providers, Hexion's management is committed to providing the resources necessary to implement this policy.  Further, Hexion recognizes that it has a duty to protect its employees and neighbors from the effects of all dangerous chemicals.

While chemicals are a fundamental component of the coatings that Hexion manufactures, each chemical is given due consideration with regard to techniques for safe handling and processing.  Therefore, even though a particular compound may not be listed within the regulations, it is handled according to any hazardous properties that it possesses.

Facility Description

Hexion Specialty Chemicals, Inc. is located in Carpentersville, Illinois, and operates primarily as a manufacturer of synthetic resins.  The following is a description of the various resins produced on a batch basis, based on the customer demand.  The main product is resin, including alkyds, polyesters, and latex emulsions.  The resins are produced via high temperature (i.e. 380- 500 F) polymerization of vegetable oils, organic acids, and polyols in reactors (or kettles).  The reaction products are then diluted using various solvents in mix tanks and shipped to customers in drums,

2,500 pound modular containers or by bulk in tank trucks.  Products are occasionally used in-house as bases.

Bases are used for production of certain modified synthetic coatings (copolymers, polyurethanes, and silicones) which are then shipped out to customers via the same three methods mentioned above.  All processes are conducted in a batch mode.  Support operations include storage tanks, and analytical laboratory, and administrative offices.

One chemical, vinyl acetate, is utilized at the facility in sufficient quantities to be subject to the requirements of 40 CFR Part 68, RMP.  Vinyl acetate is a raw material (monomer) used for latex emulsions.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The Carpentersville facility is governed by a set of OSHA and USEPA regulations that require planning and facility activities intended  to prevent a release of hazardous material, or if a release inadvertently occurs, to minimize the consequences of a release to the employees of the facility, the public and to the environment. 
These regulations include:
40CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention
40CFR Part 112, Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure
40CFR Part 264, Hazardous Waste Contingency Plan
29CFR Part 119, Process Safety Management

The key concepts in Hexion's release prevention program are employee participation, appropriate design and maintenance of equipment, and appropriate training of all employees.

Employee participation in the release prevention program is encouraged and supported by Hexion management.  Key personnel are responsible for conducting and implementing the findings from the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for vinyl acetate.  Hexion employees are also members of the facilities emergency response team.

Hexion policy is to construct all new equipment, systems, and facilities in accordance with the most current building and safety codes.  This ensures the appropriate safety and release prevention syst

ems are included from the beginning of each project.  Hexion employs the following regulations design codes and standards to ensure the safety and health of its employees, neighbors and the environment:
1.EPA 40 CFR Part 68 Chemical Accident Release Provisions (RMP).
2.EPA 40 CFR Part 112 Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasure.
3.EPA 40 CFR Part 264 and 265 Hazardous Waste Management
4.OSHA 29 CFR Part 1910.119 Process Safety Management (PSM)
5.OSHA 29 CFR Part 1910.120 Emergency Response Planning
6.National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) Standards for fire prevention and protection.
7.National Electrical Code (NEC) Standards for the design standards of electrical systems.
8.American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) Standards for pressure vessel design.
9.American Petroleum Institute (API) Standards for storage tank designs.

Hexion also maintains a computerized program of maintenance activities to ensure that key systems are maintained appropriately to minimize the risk of a release.

Hexion is commited to providing appropriate training to all employees regarding safety procedures.  Each new employee is provided comprehensive safety training during his or her initial orientation.  In addition, Hexion conducts regularly scheduled safety training for all employees each year.  Additional training is provided to maintenance personnnel for the systems they are responsible for.  Members of Hexion's emergency response team receive annual training to ensure that response actions are promptly and safely completed.

Five Year Accident History

Hexion has not had a release of vinyl acetate from the Carpentersville, Illinois facility that has caused any of the following:
On-site deaths, injuries, significant property damage, or
Off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.

Emergency Response Program

Hexion has personnel trained in emergency response at the facility 24 hours per day, seven days a week.  Th

ese personnel receive annual training on emergency procedures and response techniques.  Response activities are coordinated with the local fire department to ensure the appropriate level of response.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Hexion completes a thorough review of the vinyl acetate system each time a design change is implemented.  Hexion is committed to using these methods to identify and implement ways to improve the safety of these systems.
